title: Cool Free Font from FontFont Germany...
content:
Get Triva, a new font that is - from what I was able to understand from a Google translation- underconstruction and incomplete.  
It looks rather nice though... like Cocon but without the exaggerated personality.  
FontShop has Trivia ready for download in most type formats (including OpenType) until August 2006. It includes some not-so-useful dings as well.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195108im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image_3817.php3.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195108im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image-1_4777.php3.jpg)

[www.fontshop.de/trivia](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195108/http:/www.fontshop.de/trivia "www.fontshop.de/trivia")

And you might like the US FontFont links too:

[http://www.fontshop.com/freefonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195108/http:/www.fontshop.com/freefonts/ "http://www.fontshop.com/freefonts/")

[http://www.fontfont.com/downloads.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195108/http:/www.fontfont.com/downloads.html "http://www.fontfont.com/downloads.html")

Hope my fellow broke designers like this one,

Mikey

PS... sorry, only for non-commercial use guys :-(

 [‹ Try out FF Megano](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195108/http:/typophile.com/node/19783 "Go to previous forum topic") [Akzidenz-Grotesk doing what it does best ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911195108/http:/typophile.com/node/19767 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SuperUltraFabulous
